revised_title: Understanding Streptomycin Resistance in Bacteria: The Role of Mutation and Physiological Adaptation
tldr: This study investigates the development of resistance to streptomycin in bacteria, specifically \lt;italic\gt;Bact\lt;/italic\gt;. \lt;italic\gt;lactis aerogenes\lt;/italic\gt; (\lt;italic\gt;Aerobacter aerogenes\lt;/italic\gt;). The authors found that resistance to streptomycin results from a combination of first-stage mutation and physiological adaptation of the bacteria. They also discovered that exposing the bacteria to ultra-violet light can induce resistance in a culture of streptomycin-sensitive bacteria. This research sheds light on the mechanisms behind bacterial resistance to antibiotics and the potential for developing new strategies to combat it.
